Event.name: Operating_a_system
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Operator</fen> manipulates the substructure of a <fen>System</fen> such that the <fen>System</fen> performs the function it was created for.
This frame differs from the Using frame in that this frame does not profile the purpose of an agent but rather their manipulation of an entity (<fen>System</fen>/Instrument). In the case of using, the Agent need not manipulate the Instrument at all, as in: <ment>Mrs. Adams used the room as a place to hang the family laundry to dry</ment>.
<ex>This true story of domestic bliss was related to me by <fex name="Operator">a friend of mine</fex> <fex name="Operator">who</fex> for a time <t>operated</t> <fex name="System">a bar</fex> <fex name="Place">in San Francisco</fex>.</ex>
<ex>A California man has plead guilty to federal charges that <fex name="Operator">he</fex> <t>ran</t> <fex name="System">a pyramid scam which defrauded nearly 7000 investors.</fex></ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: System
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The entity that the <fen>Operator</fen> gets to perform its intended function.
<ex>Robert Faye, who has <t>run</t> <fex name="sys">the organization</fex> since its inception in 1991, said all the money the group has raised has been properly distributed.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Operator
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The invididual who manipulates the substructure of the <fen>System</fen>.
<ex><fex name="ope">WELS Kingdom Workers</fex> <t>operates</t> this program for students interested in doing ministry for a summer job.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the place where the <fen>Operator</fen> runs the <fen>System</fen>.
<ex>North Korea <t>Operates</t> a Restaurant <fex name="Place">in Vietnam</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root> This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Operator</fen> runs the <fen>System</fen>.
<ex>The City <t>operates</t> the system <fex name="pur">to ensure high quality water at competitive rates</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Operator</fen> runs the <fen>System</fen>.
<ex>This guaranteed donation to the charity was begun by Eric Von Stroh, Mike Cioli and Andrew Seligson, the three men who <t>ran</t> the business <fex name="Time">last year</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the Means by which an Operator runs the System.
<ex>By the end of the film you'll be marveling at Buster's dexterity while he <t>operates</t> the steamboat <fex name="Means">by climbing up and over or jumping down and around the ship</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the running of the <fen>System</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Operator</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>The farm is owned and <fex name="Mnr">carefully</fex> <t>operated</t> by John and Janice Maloney in Newberry Springs, California.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Duration</fen> denotes the length of the time interval in which the <fen>Operator</fen> runs the <fen>System</fen>.
<ex>The vendor has <t>operated</t> this business <fex name="dur">for the last 7 years</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: operate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: control the functioning of (a device, system, or institution)

lexUnit.name: run.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to be in operation

lexUnit.name: manage.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be in charge of; run.
